recipes.title: Grilled Dijon-Maple Chicken

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Beautiful and golden in color, this chardonnay has persistent ripe pear and lychee flavors that are complemented by a subtle, sweet toasty oak. Very balanced acid harmonizes the thick viscosity of this ripe and decadent wine.

recipes.instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together Dijon mustard, maple syrup and vinegar. Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Then place the chicken in a large Ziploc bag, and pour the mustard mixture in. Marinate in the refrigerator for an hour or two.After marinating, preheat grill to medium heat. When ready, grill chicken over indirect heat for 18 to 20 minutes, turning occasionally, or until juices run clear. Transfer chicken to serving dish. Sprinkle with fresh rosemary, if using, and serve. Adapted from: rachelschultz.com

steps.step: In a small bowl, whisk together Dijon mustard, maple syrup and vinegar. Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Then place the chicken in a large Ziploc bag, and pour the mustard mixture in. Marinate in the refrigerator for an hour or two.After marinating, preheat grill to medium heat. When ready, grill chicken over indirect heat for 18 to 20 minutes, turning occasionally, or until juices run clear.
Transfer chicken to serving dish. Sprinkle with fresh rosemary, if using, and serve. Adapted from: rachelschultz.com
